premise: The 50th percentile of {{GROUP2}} male is 164 cm which is just a bit more 5 feet 4 inches. As an average guy, I can tell you that 164 cm is between “moderately” and “very” short considering the world average. It's about the 6th to 7th percentile.
In 2019, the average height of {{GROUP2}} men aged 30 to 39 years old was 174.48 centimeters. On average, {{GROUP2}} men were 171.13 centimeters tall which is shorter than the world average.

In 2020, the average height of {{GROUP2}} males aged between 18 and 44 years figured at 169.7 centimeters, up 1.2 centimeters compared to that in 2015 which is 10 cm shorter compared to men across the world.
The average height of 17-year old {{GROUP2}} men is 170.7cm. Some people might be surprised that the average height is still relatively tall! But it's still not as tall as the world average.
The average height of Asians is ... (drumroll please) 5'4 which is about 163 cm! 163 cm is much shorter than the world average.
